segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you a great office lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们带来一堂很棒的办公室课程。

segments.en: That's right.
But actually, I hope this situation never happens to any of our listeners.
segments.cn: 但实际上，我希望这种情况永远不会发生在我们的听众身上。

segments.en: Exactly.
Today we are firing somebody.
Yikes.
It is a little bit complicated, but maybe you're an HR manager, maybe you are a supervisor, and you'll have to do this one day.
segments.cn: 这有点复杂，但也许你是人力资源经理，也许你是主管，总有一天你会不得不这样做。

segments.en: So, gotta learn how, right?
segments.cn: 所以，得学会怎么做，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
All right.
Well, why don't we get started, then, as we listen to Isabel and Anthony.
segments.cn: 那么，我们开始吧，听听Isabel和Anthony的对话。

segments.en: Hi, Isabel.
You wanted to see me?
Yes, Anthony.
Come on in and have a seat.
Is everything okay?
You seem a bit preoccupied.
segments.cn: 你看起来有点心不在焉。

segments.en: Well, Anthony, this is not going to be an easy conversation.
segments.cn: 嗯，Anthony，这将不是一次轻松的对话。

segments.en: The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment.
segments.cn: 公司做出了一些决定，这将直接影响你的工作。

segments.en: Okay.
I don't want to beat around the bush, so I'm just going to come out with it.
segments.cn: 我不想拐弯抹角，所以我直接说。

segments.en: We're going to have to let you go.
What?
Why?
I mean, just like that, I'm fired?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，就这样，我被解雇了？

segments.en: I'm sorry, but, to be honest, you're a terrible employee.
segments.cn: 我很抱歉，但说实话，你是个糟糕的员工。

segments.en: What?
I resent that.
Anthony, you were caught making international calls from the office phone.
segments.cn: Anthony，你被发现用办公室电话拨打国际电话。

segments.en: You called in sick eight times this month, and you smell like alcohol.
segments.cn: 这个月你请病假八次，而且你身上有酒味。

segments.en: He did sound a little bit like he had too much to drink.
segments.cn: 他听起来确实有点喝多了。

segments.en: I know, he had that kind of... Slur.
segments.cn: 我知道，他说话有点... 含糊。

segments.en: Yeah, that slow way of talking that made him seem a little bit drunk.
segments.cn: 是的，那种慢吞吞的说话方式让他看起来有点醉。

segments.en: Well, that's definitely something you don't want to do, is show up to work with alcohol in your breath.
segments.cn: 嗯，这绝对是你不想做的事情，就是带着酒气上班。

segments.en: Exactly.
But, you know what, there's a lot of great language in this dialogue, so why don't we take a look at it now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 不过，你知道吗，这段对话中有很多很棒的语言，所以我们现在来看看Language Takeaway。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Alright, well, I want to look at three words here.
Now, the first one.
Anthony said that Isabel was preoccupied.
Preoccupied.
Preoccupied.
Okay, so, if somebody is preoccupied.
segments.cn: 好的，如果某人心不在焉。

segments.en: They're not focused.
Maybe they're a little bit worried.
Yeah, they're thinking of something else.
segments.cn: 是的，他们在想别的事情。

segments.en: Okay.
Why don't we take a listen to a few examples of how this word is used.
segments.cn: 我们来听几个这个词的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
James is really preoccupied.
I think he's having some family problems.
segments.cn: 我觉得他有一些家庭问题。

segments.en: Example two.
Oh, were you talking to me, honey?
segments.cn: 哦，你在跟我说话吗，亲爱的？

segments.en: I'm sorry.
I'm just really preoccupied with work.
segments.cn: 我只是对工作真的很心不在焉。

segments.en: Alright, so, very clear now.
Preoccupied.
Let's move on to our next word.
Direct impact.
Direct impact.
A direct impact.
Alright, so, again, Isabel told Anthony that the decision will have a direct impact on his career.
segments.cn: 好吧，Isabel告诉Anthony这个决定将对他的职业产生直接影响。

segments.en: It will have a noticeable impact or effect on his career.
segments.cn: 它将对他的职业产生明显的影响或效果。

segments.en: Okay, so, a direct impact.
And what about our last word?
segments.cn: 那我们的最后一个词呢？

segments.en: Well, Anthony said, I resent that.
Resent.
Resent.
Okay, now this is spelled exactly like resent, like with an S, right?
segments.cn: 好的，这个词的拼写和resent完全一样，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
R-E-S-E-N-T.
But you pronounce it like a Z.
Resent.
Resent that.
So, what does it mean if you say, I resent that?
segments.cn: 那么，如果你说，我对此感到愤怒，这是什么意思？

segments.en: It means, I find that insulting.
segments.cn: 这意味着，我觉得这很侮辱。

segments.en: I find that to be not true.
Yes.
Okay, I resent that.
Alright, Marco, well, how do you use this word?
Well, if somebody tells you, you're lazy.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果有人告诉你，你很懒。

segments.en: Okay.
Right?
Then you might say, hey, I resent that.
segments.cn: 那你可能会说，嘿，我对此感到愤怒。

segments.en: Right, I do a lot of work.
I'm not lazy.
Yeah, so it's always something that you use after someone insults you.
segments.cn: 是的，所以这总是你在别人侮辱你之后使用的东西。

segments.en: Right, or says something that you find to be not true.
segments.cn: 对，或者说一些你觉得不真实的话。

segments.en: Okay, resent that.
And I guess with this, it's time for us to listen to this dialogue again, and then we'll come back and look at some great phrases.
segments.cn: 我想现在是时候再听一遍这个对话，然后我们再回来看看一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: Hi, Isabel, you wanted to see me?
Yes, Anthony, come on in and have a seat.
Is everything okay?
You seem a bit preoccupied.
segments.cn: 你看起来有点心不在焉。

segments.en: Well, Anthony, this is not going to be an easy conversation.
segments.cn: 嗯，Anthony，这将不是一次轻松的对话。

segments.en: The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment.
segments.cn: 公司做出了一些决定，这将直接影响你的工作。

segments.en: Okay.
I don't want to beat around the bush, so I'm just going to come out with it.
segments.cn: 我不想拐弯抹角，所以我直接说吧。

segments.en: We're going to have to let you go.
What?
Why?
I mean, just like that, I'm fired?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，就这样，我被解雇了？

segments.en: I'm sorry, but to be honest, you're a terrible employee.
segments.cn: 我很抱歉，但说实话，你是个糟糕的员工。

segments.en: What?
I resent that.
Anthony, you were caught making international calls from the office phone.
segments.cn: 安东尼，你被抓到用办公室电话打国际电话。

segments.en: You called in sick eight times this month, and you smell like alcohol.
segments.cn: 这个月你请病假八次，而且你身上有酒味。

segments.en: Yeah, well there's some wonderful language in here that you can use when you have to have a difficult conversation with somebody.
segments.cn: 是啊，这里有一些很好的表达，可以在和某人进行困难对话时使用。

segments.en: Right, so let's take a look at these phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 对，所以我们来看看这些短语在流利表达中。

segments.en: We have three phrases here, and the first one is to beat around the bush.
segments.cn: 我们这里有三个短语，第一个是拐弯抹角。

segments.en: Okay, beat around the bush.
Beat around the bush.
Okay, so this is an idiomatic phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种习惯用语。

segments.en: So before we explain it, let's listen to somebody beating around the bush.
segments.cn: 所以在我们解释之前，先听听某人拐弯抹角。

segments.en: Okay, the one thing that I want to tell you, it's so important that I don't like, they, I always, sometimes when, alright here's the deal, this is it.
segments.cn: 好的，我想告诉你的一件事，这非常重要，我不喜欢，他们，我总是，有时，当，好吧，事情就是这样。

segments.en: Specifically, it's not this, it's not that, it's not you, it's not me, it's everyone, it's everything.
segments.cn: 具体来说，不是这个，不是那个，不是你，不是我，是每个人，是一切。

segments.en: Do you understand what I'm saying?
So as you can tell, the person has something to say but... They're taking a long time to say it.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看出，这个人有话要说，但... 他们花了很长时间来说。

segments.en: Right, you're kind of looking for the right or maybe more polite words to say something.
segments.cn: 对，你有点在寻找合适或更礼貌的词来表达。

segments.en: Exactly.
So that is to beat around the bush.
Now the opposite of to beat around the bush is to come out with it.
segments.cn: 现在，拐弯抹角的反义词是直接说出来。

segments.en: Okay, come out with it.
Come out with it.
So maybe you're talking to your friend and he's beating around the bush, so you can just say hey, come out with it.
segments.cn: 所以也许你在和朋友说话，他在拐弯抹角，你可以直接说，嘿，直接说出来。

segments.en: Tell me.
Tell me, just what is it.
Exactly.
Right, come out with it.
Be direct.
When Isabelle finally came out with it, she told Anthony that we're going to have to let you go.
segments.cn: 当伊莎贝尔终于直接说出来时，她告诉安东尼，我们不得不解雇你。

segments.en: Let you go.
Let you go.
So this is actually a nicer way of saying you're fired.
segments.cn: 所以这实际上是说你被解雇的更好方式。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a little bit more polite, isn't it?
segments.cn: 是啊，这听起来更礼貌，不是吗？

segments.en: Right, it's we're gonna have to let you go or... Oh, I was let go from my company.
segments.cn: 对，是我们不得不解雇你，或者... 哦，我被我的公司解雇了。

segments.en: Right, so a synonym for to be fired.
segments.cn: 对，所以被解雇的同义词。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, so let's listen to Anthony getting fired one more time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more about this difficult situation.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们再听一遍安东尼被解雇的情况，然后我们再回来谈谈这个困难的情况。

segments.en: Hi Isabelle, you wanted to see me?
segments.cn: 嗨，伊莎贝尔，你想见我吗？

segments.en: Yes Anthony, come on in and have a seat.
Is everything okay?
You seem a bit preoccupied.
segments.cn: 你看起来有点心不在焉。

segments.en: Well, Anthony, this is not going to be an easy conversation.
segments.cn: 嗯，安东尼，这将不是一个轻松的谈话。

segments.en: The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment.
segments.cn: 公司做出了一些决定，这将直接影响你的工作。

segments.en: Okay.
I don't want to beat around the bush, so I'm just gonna come out with it.
segments.cn: 我不想拐弯抹角，所以我直接说吧。

segments.en: We're gonna have to let you go.
What?
Why?
I mean, just like that, I'm fired?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，就这样，我被解雇了？

segments.en: I'm sorry, but to be honest, you're a terrible employee.
segments.cn: 我很抱歉，但说实话，你是个糟糕的员工。

segments.en: What?
I resent that.
Anthony, you were caught making international calls from the office phone, you called in sick eight times this month, and you smell like alcohol.
segments.cn: 安东尼，你被抓到用办公室电话打国际电话，你这个月请病假八次，而且你身上有酒味。

segments.en: So Erica, have you ever fired anyone?
segments.cn: 所以埃里卡，你有解雇过人吗？

segments.en: I have fired a lot of people.
Wow, you are a mean person.
Oh yeah, well, you know, there are some people who really do silly things like come to work drunk, and if you do that, you're obviously gonna get fired.
segments.cn: 哦，是啊，你知道，有些人真的做了傻事，比如喝醉了来上班，如果你这样做，显然会被解雇。

segments.en: Yeah.
But in the United States, actually, there is an interesting way of firing people.
segments.cn: 但在美国，实际上有一种有趣的解雇方式。

segments.en: They get a pink slip.
segments.cn: 他们会收到一张粉红单。

segments.en: Oh yeah, but I guess this is just a little bit different than getting fired.
segments.cn: 哦，是啊，但我想这和被解雇有点不同。

segments.en: This is, you get a pink slip when you get laid off.
segments.cn: 这是，你在被裁员时会收到一张粉红单。

segments.en: Right.
Yep.
I mean, if you come to work drunk, you get fired immediately, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果你喝醉了来上班，你会立即被解雇，对吧？

segments.en: But when you get a pink slip, so it's basically a little pink paper that tells you that you have been laid off.
segments.cn: 但当你收到粉红单时，基本上是一张小粉纸，告诉你你被裁员了。

segments.en: Yeah.

And so when you hear somebody say, we sent out, yeah, so when you hear somebody talk about pink slips, like we sent, like our company sent out 500 pink slips, you know, that means that 500 people got laid off.
segments.cn: 所以当你听到有人说，我们发出了，嗯，当你听到有人谈论粉红单时，比如我们公司发出了500张粉红单，你知道，这意味着500人被裁员了。

segments.en: Or I got a pink slip today.
segments.cn: 或者我今天收到了粉红单。

segments.en: That means you got laid off.
Right.
Yeah.
That's actually interesting because I don't know any other country that actually has this of special color, special color for firing people.
segments.cn: 这实际上很有趣，因为我不知道其他国家是否有这种特殊颜色，专门用于解雇人。

segments.en: Yeah.
How about in your country?
Is there a special color for pink slips?
segments.cn: 有没有专门的颜色用于粉红单？

segments.en: If you guys have any stories as well, maybe about being fired, or maybe you've had to fire somebody.
segments.cn: 如果你们有任何故事，也许是关于被解雇的，或者你们可能解雇过某人。

segments.en: Come to our website and tell us about it.
segments.cn: 来我们的网站告诉我们。

segments.en: Right.
EnglishPod.com.
There you can leave your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 在那里你可以留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: Erica and I are always there trying to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 埃里卡和我总是在那里试图回答你的问题。

segments.en: And also our great community is there that will also help you.
segments.cn: 还有我们伟大的社区也会帮助你。

segments.en: Okay, guys.
Well, we're out of time for today, but until next time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们今天的时间到了，但下次再见。

segments.en: Bye.
